name: Carnal0wnage
body:
## Whoami

**Chris Gates**  
![CG](/images/cg.jpeg)  
Twitter: [@carnal0wnage] (https://twitter.com/carnal0wnage)  
Blog: [carnal0wnage.attackresearch.com](http://carnal0wnage.attackresearch.com)

## Talks Archive

### Presentations

**Ruxcon 11: "Puple Teaming: One Year After Going From Full Time Breaker To Part Time Fixer"** (pdf soon)  
Description: A little over a year ago I made the transition from external security consultant to internal offensive security engineer at Facebook. I went from a full time breaker to part time fixer. This talk is aimed at providing lessons learned and documenting the mindset changes I've made over the last year that I feel can be used by the industry as a whole. I've broken the lessons learned into three primary buckets; Red, Blue, and Purple and the talk will hopefully bring value to anyone working in their respective bucket or assist in their creation/continuing of purple teaming at their company.


**Devops Days DC 2015: "DevOoops and How I Hacked You"** [(pdf)](/papers/devoops-devopsdaysdc.pdf) [(video)](https://vimeo.com/channels/carnal0wnage/138392795)  
Description: In a quest to move faster, organizations can end up creating security vulnerabilities using the tools and products meant to protect them. Both Chris Gates and Ken Johnson will share their collaborative research into the technology driving DevOps as well as share their stories of what happens when these tools are used insecurely as well as when the tools are just insecure.
Technologies discussed will encompass AWS Technology, Chef, Puppet, Hudson/Jenkins, Vagrant, Kickstart and much, much more. This talk will most definitely be an entertaining one but a cautionary tale as well, provoking attendees into action. Ultimately, this is research targeted towards awareness for those operating within a DevOps environment. With ([Ken Johnson](http://twitter.com/cktricky))

**DOJ CyberSecurity Symposium 2015: "DevOoops"** [(pdf)](/papers/devoopsdojedition.pdf)  
Descripton: See Below.  with ([Ken Johnson](http://twitter.com/cktricky))

**LASCON 2014: "DevOoops"** [(pdf)](/papers/lascondevoopsfinal.pdf) [(video)](https://vimeo.com/channels/carnal0wnage/119805700)  
Description: In a rare mash-up, DevOps is increasingly blending the work of both application and network security professionals. In a quest to move faster, organizations can end up creating security vulnerabilities using the tools and products meant to protect them. Both Chris Gates (carnal0wnage) and Ken Johnson (cktricky) will share their collaborative research into the technology driving DevOps as well as share their stories of what happens when these tools are used insecurely as well as when the tools are just insecure.   

Technologies discussed will encompass AWS Technology, Chef, Puppet, Hudson/Jenkins, Vagrant, Kickstart and much, much more. Everything from common misconfigurations to remote code execution will be presented. This is brand new research to bring awareness to those responsible for securing a DevOps environment. ([Ken Johnson](http://twitter.com/cktricky))  

**Derbycon 2013: "Windows attacks - AT is the new black"** [(pdf)](/papers/windowsattacks-atisthenewblack.pdf) [(video)](http://vimeo.com/75928790)  
Description: A follow on to the Encyclopedia Of Windows Privilege Escalation published by InsomniaSec at Ruxcon 2011, this talk is aimed at detailing not just escalation from user to admin and admin to system, but persistence and forced authentication as well as a few other treats. (with [Rob Fuller](http://twitter.com/mubix))

### Papers (old)

EthicalHacker.net Articles  
[https://www.ethicalhacker.net/category/columns/gates](https://www.ethicalhacker.net/category/columns/gates)

Article: Hacker Defender Rootkit for the Masses [(pdf)](/papers/rootkit_for_the_masses.pdf)  
Description: Hacker Defender Rootkit How-to for hakin9 magazine.  
Published in: hackin9 magazine

Tutorial: Hping2 Basics [(pdf)](/papers/LSO-Hping2-Basics.pdf)  
Description: Basics of using Hping2 and packet reading.  
Published on: www.EthicalHacker.net 

Tutorial: Metasploit Framework Web Interface v 2.6 [(pdf)](/papers/LSO-MetasploitFrameworkWebInterfaceTutorial-v2.6.pdf)  
Description: Basics of using the Metasploit Framework Web Interface version 2.6.  
Published on: www.metasploit.com & www.EthicalHacker.net

Tutorial: TCPDump Basics [(pdf)](/papers/TCPdumpBasics.pdf)  
Description: Basics of using TCPDump.  
Published on: LearnSecurityOnline  

Tutorial: User2SID-SID2User [(pdf)](/papers/user2sidsid2user.pdf)  
Description: Basics of using User2SID & SID2User tools.  
Published on: windowsecurity.com & LearnSecurityOnline 

Tutorial: UserInfo-UserDump [(pdf)](/papers/userinfouserdump.pdf)   
Description: Basics of using UserInfo & UserDump.  
Published on: www.securitydocs.com & LearnSecurityOnline   

Tutorial: [Rainbow Tables and Rainbox Crack](http://www.ethicalhacker.net/content/view/94/24/)  
Description: Using Rainbow Table & Rainbowcrack and some information on strong passwords.  
Published on: windowsecurity.com & [www.EthicalHacker.net](http://www.ethicalhacker.net/content/view/94/24/)   
Note: The article did pretty well on digg (made the frontpage)...click here to see a [screenshot](/papers/rainbow-digg3s.jpg).  

Tutorial: HTTP Fingerprinting [(pdf)](/papers/LSO-HTTP-Fingerprinting.pdf)  
Description: Some basics of HTTP fingerprinting, concept, tools, & defenses for IIS & Apache.  
Published on: LearnSecurityOnline 

Tutorial: Metasploit Framework v3 Basics [(pdf)](/papers/metasploit_framework_v3_basics.pdf)  
Description: Basics of using MSF v3, goes with the hack videos.  
Published on: LearnSecurityOnline 

Tutorial: MS Terminal Server Cracking [(pdf)](/papers/lso_ms_terminal_server_cracking.pdf)  
Description: Using TSGrinder, TScrack, and rdesktop to crack TS user accounts. Goes with [this](http://www.ethicalhacker.net/content/view/105/24/) video.  
Published on: LearnSecurityOnline & EthicalHacker.net  
Tools: TScrack v2.1 [(Local Copy)](/papers/tscrack2.1.zip)  
Note: Also good enough to be plagiarized 

Tutorial: TEMPEST  [(pdf)](/papers/TEMPEST-Public.pdf)  
Description: Got interested in TEMPEST, did research, wrote a paper.  
Published on: www.EthicalHacker.net and www.infosecwriters.com
